title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Ham?

h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Ham?
assumptions: Deli-sliced cooked ham, ~28 g per thin slice, cured and low-fat variety, no added sauces or breading.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, curing method, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of ham contains about 45 kcal and 5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of ham?
faqs.a: Approximately 45 kcal for a standard 28 g deli slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one slice of ham?
faqs.a: About 5 g of protein per slice.
Yes, typically 320 mg sodium per slice due to curing.

faqs.q: How does slice thickness affect calories?
faqs.a: Thicker slices can double calories to ~90 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ham slices?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 1.2 g carbs per slice, mostly from sugars in curing.
